website_summaries.verdict: This keyboard offers the popular split keyboard ergonomic layout and multimedia controls of other Adesso keyboards in a model that also includes wireless connectivity.
pros: Classic ergonomic wave design and split layout places hands and wrists in the most comfortable typing position
Membrane key switches provide for accurate and quiet typing
This model combines a rich feature set into a single unit and adds the convenience of wireless connectivity for users who find flexibility in movement and workspace setup important
cons: Some users report that this keyboard will show signs of wear quickly with frequent periods of sustained use

customer_reviews.title: Eats batteries the way some people eat chocolate.
customer_reviews.text: I really thought I would enjoy it and as far as ease of typing it is great. The issue is the keyboard goes thru a set of batteries a week and the mouse does the same. Four batteries a week is not cheap over the long run and I really expected the batteries to last longer than a week. I do not use the keyboard daily and I have tried to see if battery life is increased if I turn them both off when I am done using them and it didn't. I also tried different brands of batteries to see if the batteries were the problem and no matter what brand I bought a week is all they last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap feeling and unresponsive
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box I could tell that I was going to have problems with this set. The plastics in the keyboard and mouse are very light weight and creaky which tells me that the build quality is not so great. When I started typing on it, I immediately ran into problems with the backspace key. I would strike it and...nothing. I had to press it 3 or 4 times before it would register. I have had $15 keyboard and mouse sets that performed better than this thing.
customer_reviews.author: TimK

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard and mouse are very responsive. One complaint however ...
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard and mouse are very responsive. One complaint however, the Keyboard is really loud, I consider myself a "normal" typer I am not banging away at the keys. Each keystroke bottoms out and is quote audible; not the gentle click many of you may be used to. Update: Keyboard still works great, however the wheel on the mouse no longer works. I contacted the seller BisonOffice, they have a 7 day return policy and basically told me to go away. They do not stand behind their products, I would never purchase from BisonOffice again. In my opinion they should replace the item or return my money and work with Adesso to get their money back.
customer_reviews.author: Branden Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Have had this keyboard and mouse for almost 5 years and it has worked GREAT! I even spilled coffee on it, let it dry out and it is just now starting to have some connection issues. It is a great deal for the money. Will definitely recommend this product and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Parker

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable design, cheap quality
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed by the product when I gave it the initial visual and touch/feel test. It looks and feels like cheap plastic. The "quiet" keys are really not that quiet at all. The keyboard itself is comfortable to use, but it doesn't have tabs on the back to angle it up further. The mouse is larger than most mouse I am used to using. Setup was quick and easy, and it is working perfectly. I wouldn't recommend this product to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Koppit

customer_reviews.title: the price is a joke!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard had great potential, Love the design and just everything about it but then I start typing and that darn keys stick and just slows me down. I work for a call center from home, a smoothly working keyboard is imperative and I was very disappointed in all the problems I was having so I contacted Amazon and they were very nice about sending me another one right away. I unpacked it and settled down to work and the next keyboard was even worse.. The company that MFG's this keyboard is fooling their selves by pricing it so high as if they were selling gold. this keyboard value is probably $10 or $15 at best.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda L. Vallejo

customer_reviews.title: Notjavascript:void(0) worth the it, cost your time to return it. Save your money and get a better keyboard/mouse.
customer_reviews.text: Well, I have a Microsoft Surface keyboard, but needed a cheap alternative for my office setup. I saw this and at the time had mostly positive reviews and for the price of only $14 at the time how could I go wrong I thought. However, it showed up with no 2.4hz USB device, so I never got to test it out and it simply now a pain to get repackaged and send it back. I thought I was saving money and getting a great deal but it has cost me my time, and that would have been worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: PharSidez

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard and mouse
customer_reviews.text: l have carpal tunnel and this keyboard and mouse have helped tremendously. l also like that the keys are soft to touch and make minimal noise. The mouse is the perfect size not too biv and not too small. Love thats wireless and has a blinking light that lets you know when batteries need to be replaced
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: I bought a new product, it came to be broke, the box had already been opened, and some of the letters where scratched.. Wouldn't even turn on with brand new batteries. Horrible! Horrible! Horrible!. At the same time i got this, i was moving and misplaced the tracking information and now the keyboard itself is somewhere in storage. At least i can use it for parts for other craft projects.
customer_reviews.author: Cheynne M.

customer_reviews.title: Great  Design but doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for almost a year and then keyboard shorted out and won't keep the computer on. One of the buttons is a on/off for the computer so when it shorted out, it kept turning off the computer. The design is perfect for the mouse and the keyboard but not worth the money if it won't last a year.
customer_reviews.author: CELLA PRIME

customer_reviews.title: NOT A SILENT or even quiet keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: IT IS THE NOISIEST THING EVER! This keyboard is advertised as being silent. It's not. I had to get rid of it because of the keyboard noise. It took me a week to adjust to the layout over my previous ergonomic keyboards, and I thought the sound would lessen with use, but it just got worse!
customer_reviews.author: LoneStar

customer_reviews.title: One Month
customer_reviews.text: One month to the day, key board will not function. Worked great for 1 month. I removed my laptop from the dock for a meeting and when I came back and reconnected everything, I could see the curser on the screen, but neither the keyboard or mouse would work. I changed all the batteries twice and still nothing. That was wasted money.
customer_reviews.author: Crisitn A. L. Brown

customer_reviews.title: number key 0 doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: While I find the ergonomic design quite comfortable, I work in accounting, so use the number pad ALOT. The zero on the number pad started sticking/not typing about two days after the return window closed on it. NOT happy that I will have to spend more money for a different keyboard as I cannot go on with the zero key not working. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: sarahm

customer_reviews.title: The design of the keyboard and mouse are very comfortable. I have arthritis in both hands and the ...
customer_reviews.text: The design of the keyboard and mouse are very comfortable. I have arthritis in both hands and the mouse especially is very wide and comfortable. The reason for the 3 stars is the keyboard. It is annoyingly LOUD when typing. The space bar keys are very quiet, but all other keys are obnoxious. I ended up using this keyboard at home rather than at work due to this. I've only had this product a short time, and will update my review if it changes over time. Honestly the only reason I'm keeping it right now is I love the mouse.
customer_reviews.author: djanders

customer_reviews.title: LOUD keyclicks!
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard and mouse work fine, but the 'key clicks' are LOUD! We tried this for our office with people in cubicles, and you could hear the person typing almost 20 feet away! No one posted a review on how loud the key clicks were unfortunately. So, this hopefully will help those of you trying to make a decision. If you are using this at home, by yourself, it is probably ok. The key clicks are not easy to press either by the way. You have to be a heavy handed typing person.
customer_reviews.author: CA

customer_reviews.title: Wastes batteries!
customer_reviews.text: I liked this keyboard as far as the comfort goes, but had many issues with keys sticking or not responding. Also, the mouse sucked batteries at an alarming rate. I was going through 2 a day, but then tried to remember to turn off my mouse when I was away from my computer (never had to do this with my previous wireless mouse). Even then I had to replace batteries every four days. I returned this keyboard/mouse after trying it for a couple weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: "Loose" keys make it difficut to type accurately!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this three months ago. They keys are very "loose," i.e., it takes very little pressure to make a letter. I thought I would get accustomed to it, but I did not. If you just brush an adjacent key you get two letters at once. Unfortunately, I waited too long to return it. Cannot use this keyboard any longer!!
customer_reviews.author: Joel Gray

customer_reviews.title: Fairly good keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I've been using my Adesso wireless keyboard for a little over 2 months now. The only negative I have found is, occasionally the character does not type when you press the key, especially numbers and the period. The battery is still going strong, the extra peripheral function keys all perform as they should, and the print on each key has not faded at all. Overall, I am happy with it, and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Scubee D

customer_reviews.title: Clacky key strokes
customer_reviews.text: The keys on this keyboard were surprisingly clacky. It felt like a kids' toy version: I couldn't stand using it for more a than few minutes before I put it back in the box to return it. I have the PCK-208B at work, which is a great keyboard, and I wanted one at home. I got the combo instead because I also needed a mouse, but it's NOT the same keyboard. I'm just going to get the PCK-208B and a separate mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Gandalf the White

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I literally can’t stand this keyboard! It’s too noisy and clunky. I wanted a keyboard that was wireless and had the ergonomic wave along with the numerical keypad attached, but you can tell that this was just cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Anglin

customer_reviews.title: Keys are loud, but it is quite comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: The feel is fantastic. I love the way the keys sit, and the rise in the center makes it very comfortable. I work as a freelance writer so having a good keyboard is important. I bought this one to replace one that had sticky keys and I am not disappointed. The only reason this gets 4 stars instead of 5 stars is the fact that the keys are on the louder side. If they were softer keys, I would absolutely rate this as a 5-star keyboard and mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Pullan Family

customer_reviews.title: 1 of my shift keys was loose and super loud along with one of the enter buttons (by ...
customer_reviews.text: it was okay at first until you start using it and notice how loud and clunky it is. 1 of my shift keys was loose and super loud along with one of the enter buttons (by the number pad). Had to return this. However, i did like the mouse- even though it was on the bigger side.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Toney

customer_reviews.title: High Speed Typist--not for you!
customer_reviews.text: I want to return this keyboard. I need to check to see if I'm still within the return policy timeframe. The keys stick A LOT. I'm a fast typist; however, this keyboard really slows me down. I have to really hit the keys to insure the letters display on the screen. I wouldn't call this a cheap keyboard-- I just expected a better performance based on the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: jayray

customer_reviews.title: This is a very noisy
customer_reviews.text: All my coworkers can tell if I am not working because I can't type a key without it being so noisy. Also the "0" key doesn't work well on the numeric pad so I have to double check my work any time to use a "0"
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Problem right away
customer_reviews.text: This was a nice keyboard for a few weeks, until the right spacer bar got stuck in the down position every time you pressed it. How disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly M

customer_reviews.title: Good, some key issues.
customer_reviews.text: The top 0 key needs to be pressed hard to work, which can be annoying at times, but the reaction time is spot on for every other key. I play overwatch & other games a lot, the batteries only lasted a month or so. I recommend grabbing some rechargeable batteries so you can just pop in some new ones without buying more again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Juan L. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Terrible keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I got the the Adesso WKB 1500gb ergonomic keyboard and mouse and I really dislike it. This is the noisiest keyboard ever! They keys clack really loudly when I type and I don't like that the space bar doesn't go all the way across. Another thing is that it is really hard to see the Num Loc and Caps Lock lights. They might be viewable in a dark room but that doesn't work well in am office setting. Pass on this one, you will be thankful you did!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super loud
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is comfortable, but it is super loud. I had to stop using it. Also, it chewed through batteries really fast. Finally, occasionally, the dongle would lose connection and it would skip a letter or two while you are typing. Really annoying. This is not a reliable keyboard. I do not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: David Boucher

customer_reviews.title: what a relief!
customer_reviews.text: The ergonomic design is great relief over standard flat keyboard, and the mouse fits a right-handed person very comfortably. The keys are a bit clacky-sounding, so it might bother some. The bluetooth adapter is very tiny, and fits so snugly that at first I wasn't sure I was inserting correctly. I had no trouble getting the keyboard and mouse synced. I recommend it for the ergonomic design and the cordless convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set because my carpal tunnel has been flaring up and it definitely has helped. The only thing I'm not crazy about is the keyboard is very clicky (loud) but other than that, I am pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: GJR

customer_reviews.title: Nice Ergo Set
customer_reviews.text: My only regret is that the space bar is split (not one central piece). My thumbs tend to miss the smaller space bars. Mouse is large, comfortable & fast.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a month, terrible tech support and return policy
customer_reviews.text: Broke after a month, keys started randomly modifying. Literally the only thing tech support suggested was changing the (brand new) battery. Which I'd already done. After that, I can fill out a bunch of paperwork and then pay to ship it back at my own expense. Horrible customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Eve Richter

customer_reviews.title: So LOUD and not soft touch
customer_reviews.text: The shape of the keyboard is fine but I have to slam my finger down on the Enter key to get it to work and every keystroke sounds like a plunk of water in the bottom of an empty metal bucket. Would not order again.
customer_reviews.author: Kerie

customer_reviews.title: I love the layout of both the mouse and kb
customer_reviews.text: I love the layout of both the mouse and kb, very nice - A+ for that. The "could be better" part is the quality. It's kind of noisy (kb) and neither are particularly durable. I was surprised because I have the same wired version of this kb at work and I love it. The range, connectivity and ergonomics are good. If the quality were there, I would be happy to give this 5 stars and for the price, this really should have been better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nielsens

customer_reviews.title: Problem - but taken care of in a short time.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard and mouse are working great. I had a problem with the keyboard after a few days, several of the keys quit working. I returned it for a replacement. I used amazon prime and it was a simple process. I had a new keyboard and mouse within a 4 days. I have been using it for a month and it is still going strong. The keyboard is a split keyboard and is almost the same as my old ergonomic keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: AL

customer_reviews.title: LASTED THREE MONTHS
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this keyboard/mouse from amazon September 2013 and through it out for trash this morning. Some keys on the right side of the keyboard stopped working. It's a shame because I really liked the design and feel of this keyboard. Don't waste you money on this one!
customer_reviews.author: joanuhrin

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Big upgrade over the keyboard I was provided at work. Really like the ergonomic design/slightly split keyboard setup. Had a little issue with the batteries provided, by Adesso customer service was fantastic and helped me resolve my issue. The keyboard is comfortable and a great value in my opinion. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Poor Response
customer_reviews.text: Generally speaking this keyboard is ok. The 10-key is at an odd angle and not ergonomic at all. I have to twist my wrist at an odd angle to use it. The caps key is not very responsive. I am constantly having to backspace because the caps button didn't capture my capital letters. The same with the 10-key. I know I have short fingers but have never had this issue with other ergonomic keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: Better Life Dental Center

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves this ergonomic keyboard and mouse
customer_reviews.text: Got product for my wife for her home office. She loves it, says her wrists and forearms feel much better using it. Keys can be a tad loud, but not excessively. Battery power has lasted almost 3 months now.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley S.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Product--Keeps Breaking
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product! It's terrible. The actual design of the keyboard is good but the keyboard doesn't work. I bought my keyboard and then within a few weeks some keys stopped working. I got a replacement from Amazon. It worked when I used on it on rare occasion but then the receiver broke. Two keyboards broke in less than two months under very occasional use I tried getting Adesso to fix and they are completely unresponsive. I'm looking into buying another USB receiver but then I have to pour more money into this thing. Right now I just have a keyboard and mouse that don't work. Save yourself the hassle and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Second one to fail
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Adesso keyboard that I have had the misfortune to have. Both have failed in the same exact way, keys quite working...starting with the numbers. Of course each one failed after the 30 day return period expired. Do yourself a favor and avoid this product at all costs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard and mouse combination. The construction, weight and ease of use is top notch. So as long as it doesn’t die one day after warranty like the last elec product I bought, then it’s defo a thumbs up!!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Kindle

customer_reviews.title: keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. It's comfortable to use and the keys are easy to press accurately.
customer_reviews.author: Ramona Matteson

customer_reviews.text: The space bar is split. It doesn't go all the way across the bottom of the keyboard. As a result, I often miss the space bar and have to go back and correct where words have run together. The light for the caps lock should be brighter. It is hard to see in a well lit room.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret A. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: Although this keyboard took some getting use too. It was very comfortable to use. Since I have had carpal tunnel, regular keyboards would aggravate my symptoms within seconds and with this one it would take a while longer. The downfall is that after a few weeks of use the keys would take more and more effort to get them to work. So not a good quality keyboard. Find something that's built better.
customer_reviews.author: Deanareno

customer_reviews.title: needs legs to lift up
customer_reviews.text: The only issue that i have with this keyboard is that is doesn't have the little feet to raise it up on an incline.
customer_reviews.author: Florence B.

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed for work. I like the on/off options that my last one didn't have. Not bulky or complicated.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Go with Microsoft instead, with the few extra $$
customer_reviews.text: It was reasonably comfortable. However they keys are "clicky" and it was so loud it was unusable. It was purchased for my office and I spend a fair amount of time on teleconferences, I could not type if I was not on mute. Exchanged for the Microsoft Sculpt similar wilreless keyboard which was a bit more expensive, but worth every penny (including the cost to return this one).
customer_reviews.author: A Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible and loud
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst keyboard and mouse I have ever had. Most reviews say how quiet it is, this one is loud. But the main issue is the mouse. I feel like I am playing pong rather than using a mouse. at the low dpi it is so slow you fall asleep getting any where and on the other settings it is like the mouse is disconnected from the pointer. You kind of have to pounce on the target rather than glide to it. Going to return to Amazon and get a good logitec or microsoft.
customer_reviews.author: splash

customer_reviews.title: It's is good for a split keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Need to change the battery about every 3 weeks. My right space bar rarely works.
customer_reviews.author: Hewett

customer_reviews.title: Adesso felt and performed like a very low quality product.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard was very loud. In a open work environment it was almost distracting other workers. The combo worked for a couple of months and then the sensor decided everything needed to be tracking to the right. Even when I grabbed the bottom bar and pulled the window to the left, as I held it, it still tried to fight me and push everything to the right. I turned off the mouse and it still pushed it right. I swapped out the mouse and keyboard and now everything works fine. I will not buy Adesso again.
customer_reviews.author: Designing

customer_reviews.title: Nice touch and feel to the keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I use this same keyboard at work and I have been working at home remotely so I wanted to have the same exact keyboard
customer_reviews.author: Eileen mcgovern

customer_reviews.title: Poor Connection
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard and mouse are less than a year old and about a month ago, the items have stopped functioning. Bluetooth connection is poor and it does not connect so unsure if it is the product or the sensor. Heads up, get the protection/coverage for this product. We will not be purchasing this from the manufacturer again.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my wife. She says the keyboard makes typing much easier, and the large mouse is really easy to control.
customer_reviews.author: Herr Weh

customer_reviews.title: Not Top Quality
customer_reviews.text: The shape of the keyboard is exactly as I needed. However, the quality of the product is not the greatest. When typing, the keys are very "loose" feeling and it makes an annoying noise as you press down on each key. It's very loud when typing at any speed. Just feels cheap.
customer_reviews.author: ROBIN HODGES

customer_reviews.title: I appreciate the split keyboard as it is ergonomic and its comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Having a difficult time getting it to type what I write. I guess because its wireless, it tends to buffer and truncate what I'm typing as I type fast. Other than that, I appreciate the split keyboard as it is ergonomic and its comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: D. Drumm

customer_reviews.title: it works ok
customer_reviews.text: keyboard is plastic and feel a bit "cheap". letters are loud and go "clickety clack" when typing. the riser on "f" and "j" that allows me to feel keys on fingers are not high enough to be felt easily. but mouse is terrific. all in all, not terrific as a combination but good enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The only good thing is that it connects with no problem to ...
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made and loud when you type on it. This can and is a bother for my co-workers! The only good thing is that it connects with no problem to the computer.
customer_reviews.author: William L Bonom Jr

customer_reviews.title: Noisy keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Works great helps with my hands however it is noisy. Not a quiet keyboard. Wish the toggle usb had a cord attached to it so it doesn’t get lost.
customer_reviews.author: amber Smothermon

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money and its loud
customer_reviews.text: Mouse is very unresponsive, but scrolls but doesn't move. The keyboard is very loud. I bought this product twice and twice disappointed at how quick the batteries drain, I thought the first purchase was faulty but its consistently bad.
customer_reviews.author: Brandie Shepard

customer_reviews.title: Keys are SO loud.
customer_reviews.text: Tried using this in the office but everyone and their mother could hear me typing up emails. Keyboard is mostly hard plastic and not a very comfortable feel. Takes a little getting used to the typing but pretty nice in the ergonomics.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Barndt

customer_reviews.title: Tore up 2 days after refund policy expired.
customer_reviews.text: This product gave me problems immediately, but I chose to work around them. The 1 key started sticking within a week of getting it. I tried to return it when I was unable to log into my computer because letters were being typed. I tried everything, and finally had someone look at my computer only to find out it was the mouse. We replaced the batteries, but the problem persisted. Upon attempting to return it, we discovered that it was too late to return it by 1 week. Nevermind the fact that we spent 5 days trying to figure out the problem. DON'T BUY THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: LaShanta

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre at best
customer_reviews.text: Ugh.. keyboard is great for the ergonomic design however the noise it produces when typing is crazy! Also, you have to push the buttons very hard or sometimes the letters don’t show up.. a bit aggravating most of the time. Overall, not pleased but will keep it for now.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Kuykendall

customer_reviews.title: Typing is loud
customer_reviews.text: I have tried for months to get use to how loud typing is... it not only drives me nuts but everyone around me. The vendor of this basically said oh well you have had it too long for us to do anything. I would say keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie  McMillan

customer_reviews.title: A NOT "OK" wireless keyboard and mouse combination
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard/mouse combination is not OK . . . ultra light weight, and not quite balanced, its keys offer a wide array of functionality. The shift key has a habit of sticking, several other keys seem to just stop working; mouse is OK. Generally, an unacceptable combination. Have put it in a drawer . . . won't use it again. Simply not reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce W. Vieweg

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with this product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased August 3, 2017 and 2 months later the keyboard stopped working. Received a replacement keyboard / mouse on October 16, 2017 and the wireless range is only 2 feet, hence requesting another RMA. Very disappointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Buzz Lightyear

customer_reviews.title: Several keys on the keyboard don't work!
customer_reviews.text: Great ergonomic design, but the several keys namely the shifts and period and comma on the keyboard don't work! Unfortunately I missed the return window so guess I'm stuck purchasing a Microsoft instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: At first the keyboard was working just fine. I have had it for a month now ...
customer_reviews.text: At first the keyboard was working just fine. I have had it for a month now and the mouse needs to be clicked hard sometimes in order for it to work. I even changed the batteries and I still have the same problem. Sometimes the arrow on the screen gets stuck and I need to re click the button at the top. I don't think I can return it at this point since I already threw away the original box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product 2 years ago and it has completely stopped working. Not worth the money if you have to rebuy every other year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't even work right from the beginning
customer_reviews.text: This is the absolute worst keyboard and mouse set I have ever used. I couldn't even use it for more than 10 minutes. The F3 key doesn't work which I use for work all the time and then the mouse doesn't react to your movements more than half the time. I highly suggest you skip this item.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew P.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Keys are really loud but it has all I need and the ergonomic design is what I need
customer_reviews.author: LaVonne Beneke

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Initially I liked it because; "It's definitely helped w/my wrist problems a lot." **But now I have a hard time getting the keys to work while typing. It's taking a long time to just write this short review.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L.

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for a co-worker and we are happy with this item
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a co-worker and we are happy with this item. Glad it is available/in stock. Great price, and Prime free shipping is a bonus. I recommend this item to anyone who works on a computer all day.
customer_reviews.author: Charmayne from Alaska

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY
customer_reviews.text: This broke down in less than 6 months - I don't recommend that anyone buys this. Keyboard is nice but when that and the mouse don't last 6 months you are wasting money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Wong

customer_reviews.title: A Review about the Adesso Wireless Keyboard?, You're Kidding, Right?
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I set it up, used it for a week, then the cursor would 'freeze', the keyboard would freeze, (it would require a computer 'restart')... Stored in a dark corner of my closet. I tried to use it with my 15 year old 'tower' with XP on it. Maybe my equipment is too old. Amazon, don't contact Adesso. Don't want to hear from them, don't want anything to do with them, don't want my $ back. It's a 'learning experience!!' - David G
customer_reviews.author: David Gorman

customer_reviews.title: Not complete and missing a tini but crucial component.....
customer_reviews.text: Received my order looks great and nearly brand new. Wireless key board and mouse combo is missing the USB plug for it to communicate with the PC. Making it utterly useless and a $50 paper weight. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Billy wu

customer_reviews.title: Returned for refund
customer_reviews.text: I love split keyboards. This one was noisy and felt cheap. It is a keyboard/mouse combo. The mouse died within 2 weeks. I returned the whole set and bought a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Shaffette

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: Never had this brand but regretting it. The keys stick alot and it's making my carpal tunnel hurt worse.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: So - so
customer_reviews.text: Not as pleased with this one as I was with my other keyboard. I love the natural and I thought this would be close. When typing it seems to not grab all the letters pressed. It's okay for now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would purchase again
customer_reviews.text: I liked this keyboard so much I bought one for home and one for work use in the office.
customer_reviews.author: Orders Thompson

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard never worked and the support team kept providing odd instructions that still didn’t get it to work. Now I can’t return the item that never worked.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: not recommended
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this item, the first one the keys were sticking, we re ordered hoping it was a 1 time issue, the replacement also has keys sticking and a key has fallen off in the first month of use.
customer_reviews.author: ANIXTER INC

customer_reviews.title: Decrease wrist pain while typing!
customer_reviews.text: I use this with a new laptop that I got. I love being able to type freely without accidentally moving the curser. This keyboard is easy to get used to key placement and is very easy on wrist conditions like arthritis and carpal tunnel.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri P

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a few months-
customer_reviews.text: Broke after just a few months minimal usage. Mouse is on the larger size (which is what I wanted) and still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Justin D Callies

customer_reviews.title: keyboard doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: The shipping was very timely. I received it the very next day! the mouse works great. But i have spent over an hour trying to get the keyboard work and no such luck. The keyboard had batteries in it when i opened it, as if someone had purchased it and returned it because it wasnt working. Very upset about this since i spent so much money on the product.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Macciola

customer_reviews.title: Loud
customer_reviews.text: I like the keyboard but it is probably one of the loadest typers I've ever used.
customer_reviews.author: B. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Keys too high & noisy
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard is very noisy and keys sit too high above the base for comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Key are big and bulky and loud
customer_reviews.text: This product is probably worth what I paid for it. The keyboard and mouse and both big. The keyboard is loud when typing. I will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: ccfarm2000

customer_reviews.title: Junk x 2
customer_reviews.text: This is the second set that I have ordered in 6 months. On the first one the mouse stopped working after a few weeks. The company I ordered from refunded my money and I ordered a new one from Amazon LLC. I received that one on June 4. Today, the wireless receiver fell apart. When I tried to remove it, part of it stuck in the USB port. I just hope this piece of junk didn't ruin the USB Port on my computer. I won't give it a third chance, that's for sure. I will suck it up and order the expensive Microsoft version of the ergonomic keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Kate C

customer_reviews.title: adesso tru-form wirless keyboard and mouse
customer_reviews.text: I would not purchase this again. The mouse wouldn't work. I had to send it back and they had to send me a new one. It wasn't any better. I gave up and just bought a different one. Piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: KATHLEEN KELLY

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard is so loud. I even had a ...
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is so loud. I even had a lady with no finger nails type on it and the keys are so loud you can hear me typing in my bosses closed office. I waited too long to return it, but I am very Unhappy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Fox

customer_reviews.title: I need all the letters of the alphabet.
customer_reviews.text: Granted it isn't as popular of a letter as 'S' or even 'R', but a 'Y' is still pretty necessarh.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated
customer_reviews.text: This not not compatible with all computers. When you type letters you would get numbers.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: loud key strokes
customer_reviews.text: loud keyboard, makes me feel like i'm too loud typing
customer_reviews.author: LA

customer_reviews.title: Horrible keyboard. Keys stick and is uncomforable.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't read the reviews prior to purchasing this unit until after the order. Bad on my part. The other negative reviews were right on target. The keys stick and it is uncomfortable. The mouse is comfortable, but don't like how it moves. Don't Buy!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Mart

customer_reviews.title: Instead I bought her a Logitech Mk5500 like the one I had been using and can't recommend ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my assistant and had to return it within a week because one of the keys was sticking. Instead I bought her a Logitech Mk5500 like the one I had been using and can't recommend that brand highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: MaryG

customer_reviews.title: OK SO FAR
customer_reviews.text: I've had this keyboard for about 3 days and so far OK. I don't like that there isn't a way to elevate it like most keyboards. there should be padding on the wrist rest area. It's just hard plastic
customer_reviews.author: Todd Thiede

customer_reviews.title: The look and feel are great and they ergonomic feel couldn't be better
customer_reviews.text: The look and feel are great and they ergonomic feel couldn't be better. The only thing I'd change are the keys are noisy as you type.
customer_reviews.author: Fernie

customer_reviews.title: Throw your money in the trash Instead!  You'll get more satisfaction that way...
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is complete junk. Poor quality, loud, sticking keys and spacebar, and keys keep popping off! PROS: Sits tall enough to be used as a door stop. That's all its really good for. Zero (.000001) stars on this POS!
customer_reviews.author: Zero-Driver

customer_reviews.title: After several months it's starting to wear out.
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes back space doesn't work after several months of ownership.
customer_reviews.author: Paulina

product_meta.title: Adesso WKB-1500GB - Wireless Ergonomic Desktop Keyboard and Laser Mouse with Split Keys Design and Palm Rest for Comfort, Long Battery Life, Nano Receiver - Compatible for PC & Windows XP/7/8/10,Black
product_meta.description:
The Adesso True-Form media 1500 Wireless ergonomic keyboard & Mouse offers two advanced wireless input devices that has ergonomic design and multifunctional features. The keyboard is designed with split keys and a sloped and contoured shape, encouraging your hands, wrists, and forearms in natural position for maximum comfort during long use. The included ergonomic wireless laser mouse provides a comfortable grip and has two Internet navigational buttons and a built-in DPI switch for different resolution adjustment (800/ 1200/ 1600DPI).

(845 g)
mouse specifications: connection: 2.4GHz radio frequency wireless technology working range: 30 ft (tracking method: laser sensor DP I levels: 3 levels ‐ 800/ 1200/ 1600Battery: (2) a A a Dimensions: 3.3 x 5.0 x 1.Prime; (85 x 127 x 44 InWeight: 3.2 oz. (95 requirements: operating system: Windows 2000/ XP/ Vista/ 7/ 8/ 10Connectivity interface: USB Port for wireless receiver

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Adesso Tru-Form Media 1500 Wireless Ergonomic Keyboard & Mouse offer users two advanced input devices with ergonomic design, multifunctional features and a wireless range of up to 30 feet. The design of this keyboard with splitted key zones and gently sloped shape encourages natural position of hands, wrists, and forearm in maximum comfort for long use. The included wireless laser mouse not just provides comfortable ergonomic design but also equips with a DPI switch for changing resolution (800/ 1200/ 1600) and two Internet navigation buttons.
feature_bullets: 2.4 GHz wireless technology - with 2.4GHz RF wireless technology you can enjoy working at any angle and at distance of up to 30 ft
Ergonomic design - The design of this keyboard with splitted key zones and gently sloped shape encourages natural position of hands, wrists, and forearm In maximum comfort for long use
Internet & Multimedia hotkeys - Get instant access to your commonly used internet and multimedia tools with the 20 built-in hotkeys this keyboard has to offer
Advanced laser sensor - The advanced laser sensor technology lets you work on almost any surface with improved speed, accuracy and reliability than traditional mice

Dpi switch & Navigation hotkeys - quickly and easily adjust mouse DPI resolution (800/ 1200/ 1600) for a faster response with the convenient DPI switch located at the top of mouse. This mouse also includes two convenient side internet forward & back buttons for quick internet navigation
2.4GHz Radio Frequency Wireless Technology With 2.4GHz RF wireless technology you can enjoy working at any angle and at distance of up to 30 ft.
Ergonomic Design The design of this keyboard with split key zones and gently sloped shape encourages natural position of hands, wrists, and forearm in maximum comfort for long use.
Quiet Membrane Key Switches Membrane key switches provide a better tactile response and a quieter typing experience. Plus they last up to five million keystrokes.
Internet & Multimedia Keys Get instant access to your commonly used Internet and multimedia tools with the 20 built-in hotkeys this keyboard has to offer.
Operating System: Windows 2000 / XP / Vista / 7 / 8 / 10; Connectivity Interface: USB port for wireless
